TopicTitle: Is time wrap no longer limited near planets

Articles.Content:
Something I just recently saw, I was doing a science run around Kerbin, my ship reached about 14 million metres above Kerbin and started to fall back towards the planet. I put the time wrap on a high speed, expecting the game to slow down as we passed below certain altitudes, but it didn't and my ship smashed into the planet surface. I did a second test and found I could time wrap at the highest speed while only a 100,000 m above the surface.

Is this something new I hadn't notice in the changelog or is it a bug that happened to my save while updating. I couldn't find anything in the settings or difficulty settings.
It happens if you engage the highest type of warp.

Yes, if you come in fast under the highest warp you might fool the system, I managed to miss an Eve intercept entirely,

Game check for position every frame, on highest warp it might pass hours in game between each check

Mmmm Time Wrap.... *drools down shirt

Well, that's nothing new to me. That's why it took so long for me to do Mun and back. It occurs naturally if you have a laggy computer(like mine!)
